intro: Prockia bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahia prockia, is a rare flowering plant native to the humid regions of Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often near streams or in dense undergrowth. It has small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to habitat loss, Prockia bahiensis is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
